results.title: Prisoner: the early years [DVD]
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Prisoner [Cell block H]”.
166 (dirs. Rod Hardy, Juliana Focht, prod. Philip East, wri. Alistair Sharp): Top Dog Bea Smith (Val Lehman) leads 6 of her fellow prisoners through an escape tunnel during a pantomime. Terror mounts when the tunnel collapses; there will be fatalities. There’s disgruntlement amongst prison staff regarding work conditions. “287” (dir: John McRae, prod. Ian Bradley, wri. John Mortimore): Enter “The Freak” (Maggie Kirkpatrick) with her trademark leather gloves in tow. Christine (Amanda Muggleton) is arrested while breaching parole, Lizzie (Sheila Florance) has a hangover and the search is on for a secret distillery in the prison. Burns (Collette Mann) plays bookie. “327” (dir. Juliana Focht, prod. John McRae, wri. Anne Lucas): The Freak uses intimidation when searching for her lost diaries. A deliberately lit fire finds The Freak and Smith trapped togther in the cells. The women are relocated to a men’s prison due to fire damage. “400” (dir. Mark DeFriest, prod. Lex Van Os, wri. Ian Smith): Hazel assists Jude to suicide and has to deal with the legal consequences of her actions. With assistance from The Freak, there’s moves for a new Top Dog following Smith’s abrupt departure. Cast includes Elspeth Ballantyne, Judith McGrath, Betty Bobbitt, Val Lehman, Amanda Muggleton and Jane Clifton. Introduced by Peter McTighe. PLEASE NOTE: date recorded is copyright year and usually preceeds the screening year.

results.title: Prisoner: fire at Wentworth
results.creator_credit: John McRae and Reg Grundy Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Prisoner [Cell block H]”.
326 (dir: Chris Adshead, wri. Dave Worthington): Barbara Fields is placed in isolation following an attack and the destruction of her cell by women eager to get their hands on Ferguson’s diary. Bea has to wait another 6 months for the parole board hearing and Judy has to deal with the consequences of a suicide at the women’s shelter. “327” (dir. Juliana Focht, wri. Anne Lucas): The Freak uses intimidation when searching for her lost diaries. A deliberately lit fire finds The Freak and Smith trapped in the cells together. The women are relocated to a men’s prison due to fire damage. Cast includes Elspeth Ballantyne, Judith McGrath, Betty Bobbitt, Val Lehman, Amanda Muggleton and Jane Clifton.

results.title: Prizzi's honor
results.creator_credit: John Huston, John Foreman and ABC Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: Jack Nicholson stars as Charley Partanna an aging hit-man for a powerful Mafia family, the Prizzis. He meets and falls in love with Irene Walker (Kathleen Turner) the widow of his latest victim, masquerading as a tax consultant. When he discovers that Irene is a hired killer and has cheated his own Mafia family, his loyalties are painfully divided. To complicate matters, Maerose Prizzi, (Anjelica Huston in an Academy Award winning performance for Best Supporting Actress), the black sheep of the powerful clan, harbors a lost love for Charley and manoeuvers the plot of this tragic-comedy in insidious ways. Based on the novel by Richard Condon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Huston, John Foreman and ABC Motion Pictures
